What difference does it make if it looks beautiful but is gone so quickly? It’s not like I’m going to carry this around with me and touch up every hour on the hour? Wanted to love because it was beautiful for the very short time it was on but was very disappointed. No other highlighter I own (high end or drugstore), fades this fast.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content:
I am enjoying the shade Universal a lot more than I thought I would. I had wanted this in Glitz as I liked the colours, but could not get past the micro glitter in it. The four shades in Universal are all lovely and each have the same beautiful smooth, finely milled texture. I find the top two shades less pigmented than the bottom two, but not in a bad way, they are the perfect versatile highlighters that can be worn sheer/glowing from within or built up for a more intense finish. I have never used a white highlighter before and was worried it might look ashy, but Strobe White is very wearable and what I turn to on a light makeup day. Strobe Gold is actually quite similar to Becca Champagne Pop in tone, just a little less peachy, and a lot more natural looking. I didn’t think I would like Blush Pink as much as it’s a cooler tone, but it has actually become a favourite of mine as it is great layered on top of blushes, and I find it makes my face look more “refreshed”. Blush Bronze is a little too dark for my light medium skin tone as a bronzer for natural looks, but like many others have said, it is really, really beautiful on the lid and very buildable. Overall really recommend this palette!

user_specs: ['Hair Condition Curly', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
Amazing holy grail highlight palette! I prefer 002 Glitz to the Universal version because the colors lean more warm toned and golder in this palette which works better for my olive skin tone. I love the top two shades in the palette which are “strobe” effect powders. They have a very glossy, wet looking shine and do have small shimmer particles, but I love the look it gives. If you have a lot of texture on your skin you may prefer the Universal 001 as those shades are more pearlized in finish. Overall, amazing formula and colors and I can’t stop reaching for this palette!

review_content:
All of the reviews are true! This product truly changed my entire makeup routine and look. It makes your skin look so healthy and glowy without any sparkle or glitter. The blush and bronzer shades can be worn on their own, but I like to layer them on top of my usual Tarte blush and Hourglass bronzer. If you're considering buying this product, do it! I've never found a product that does what this palette can.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Dry']
['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
Perfect for makeup newbies and seasoned pros. These shades are so wearable and versatile! I use the pink on my "no makeup" days as a subtle blush. I use the white under my brows. I use the gold on my cheekbones. I use the bronze when I want to make a mega statement (or even on my shoulders and collar bone!!) BEST PART is when I go away overnight I just take *this* palette and a couple brushes. It's got me good for highlight, blush, bronze and eyeshadow. Couldn't be simpler! Just an fyi, the blush is very light in pigment so this won't replace a proper blush if you want really strong color! I really appreciate that the highlight is a shimmer and not glitter. My synthetic brushes pick up product easily. My Tom Ford brushes (the old ones that are fur) also pick up product beautifully. There's zero fallout. It's just an amazing product! I love this backstage palette and the backstage foundation so much.

Will be returning this item. When it arrived to my house, two of the colors had popped out of the case and the case itself was covered in chunks of powder and smudges. Rough handling, maybe, but doesn't make me feel good that a $45 palette doesn't have better packaging. The actual makeup is fine, just not worth it for me. I used a tiny amount and it looked very glittery on the skin. If that doesn't bother you, or if you are using it for nighttime or a photoshoot, I think it's fine, but frankly there are much better highlighters out there for a better price.

user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I have come to love this palette, but it didn't happen overnight. I saw it on the website and picked it up on a whim. I was quite excited when I got the package and tried it on without having much makeup on underneath. This first trial was a disaster as I could barely see any hint of pigment on my face, just what seemed like glitter. I left it sitting on my shelf for a few days, but decided to give it another shot for an evening out. I had on foundation, setting powder, etc., and swiped this product on my cheekbones. I immediately noticed the mirror lights pick up the tone (color) of the highlighter and it had a subtle sheen. There was no hint of glitter. I caught my reflection in mirrors several times through the course of the evening and noticed the product gave me a beautiful glowy look. I then tried it on again during the day, on top of my foundation and powder and noticed it really had luster in sunlight which made my skin look healthy and dewy. It took a minute to figure this palette out, but it has now become my favorite.
…read more

user_specs: ['Hair Condition Dry', 'Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I own the 001 universal palette and love it so much that I couldn’t wait to get this 002 version. After playing with it I have to say it’s a very odd palette that definitely isn’t for everyone. 1st: I think the colors are for fair to light skin only on this one, and maybe not too fair (?) 2nd: the peach highlight is very smooth but it definitely can’t act like a blush, like the pink one can in 001, and it doesn’t show too much as a highlight either on my fair skin—I had to really layer this to get much color or effect on my skin (which is the new lightest shade of foundation Dior makes) 3rd: the top 2 highlights have shimmer in them more suitable for an event or eyeshadow than an everyday highlight 4th: the top left white-yellow highlight is kind of ugly, like an ugly gold with hints of pee green in the shift, and I don’t even like it on my eyes. When packed as an inner corner highlight or center of the eye it’s very green-yellow in color more so than gold. Really the only shade I love is the bronzer, which is beautiful for fair people, and I like the pink highlight at top but I don’t know that I have to have such a shimmery formula. This may go back

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content:
WOW WOW WOW. If I had to sum it up in a single word three times, that would be it. What a palette! I have several Dior highlighters but these seem even more pigmented and beautiful somehow. Yes, the pans are smaller than in other highlighter palettes, but the shades are so incredibly pigmented you don't need them to be any bigger than this. I was originally hesitant about the two bottom shades in particular because I'm quite fair (NC20). But they're both very wearable. The pink looks great over blush or kind of in between blush and a lighter highlighter, and I love to use the bronze shade over top of a matte bronzer to really become a beautiful glowing goddess. I own many, MANY highlighters but this palette lives on my countertop and it's the only one I own where I can actually see myself hitting pan someday. This palette seriously has something for every look and I think it would look great on any skintone (if applied properly). If I had to live with only one highlighter product for the rest of my life, I would choose this one in a heartbeat. I don't even have to take the time to think about that choice!
